732509f-a.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Food - Refreshments - Watermelon.
732509f-a.text:
Sliced watermelon vendor on First Ave., at the N.E. corner of 11th Street. Note the retail market on the west side of the Ave., with the Second Ave. Elevated Line overhead.
Summer 1923.
P. L. Sperr.

707516f-a.text:
176 First Avenue, south of 11th Street; Easter pastries.
April 5, 1928.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

neg. no. 269

711071f-a.text:
11th Street, east on north side, from 321 East 11th Street, showing pushcarts and slum life in this neighborhood. The elevated is the Second Avenue line, which runs on First Avenue south of 23rd Street.

July 24, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

732528f-a.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Miscellaneous.
732528f-a.text:
Shopping for food and commodities, is serious business here, at First Ave., and 11th Street.

July 24, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

707517f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, north from just above 11th Street. The branch office of the Bank of Sicily Trust Company, at 196 First Avenue on the S.E. corner of 12th Street, was established at that
location only recently, after 1925.

May 19, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

Neg no.968

707518f-b.text:
(1)
First Avenue, west side, north from 11th Street.
Easter Sunday, April 1, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
Neg # 96[7?]

(2)
The same, from 185 First Avenue above 11th Street. 185-187, the two-story meat market, is a new building, built about 1930; it replaced the old four-story structure, also a meat market, which used to stand there.
Easter Sunday, April 1, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)

732361f-a.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Clothing - Handkerchiefs.
732361f-a.text:
Handkerchief merchant at open market on First Ave., near 11th
Street.
May 19, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

732339f-a.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Clothing - Dry goods.
732339f-a.text:
(1)
Dry goods market on East 11th Street, just around the corner
from the First Ave., pushcarts.
June 25, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, in close up.
July 24, 1930.
PL.Sperr

Dry-goods vendor on the side-walk at the N.W. corner of 11th Street and First Ave.
July 19, 1935.

The same.
